metadata.title: CVE-2020-27619 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In Python 3 through 3.9.0, the Lib/test/multibytecodec_support.py CJK codectests call eval() on content retrieved via HTTP.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
python3.6-examples - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

idle-python3.7 - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
libpython3.7 - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
libpython3.7-minimal - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
libpython3.7-stdlib - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
libpython3.7-testsuite - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
python3.7 - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
python3.7-examples - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
python3.7-minimal - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
python3.7-venv - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
No subscription required

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
libpython3.8 - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
python3.8 - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
python3.8-examples - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
python3.8-venv - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4').
python3.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.5-2~18.04.4').
python3.8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.0-3~18.04.1').
